required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Enhancing Synaptic Plasticity and Cognition in Schizophrenia
clinical_study.official_title: Enhancing Synaptic Plasticity and Cognition by Physical Exercise and Cognitive Training in Schizophrenia: A Randomised Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: To explore: (a) if physical exercise (sports) combined with cognitive training leads to (superior) improvement of cognition in schizophrenia compared to sports or cognitive training alone (b) if a sports program alone or in combination with cognitive training has influence on hippocampal pathology and synaptic plasticity in schizophrenia compared to a placebo condition.

primary_outcome.description: Measurement of hippocampal volume before and after the exercise intervention, 3T-MRI MPRAGE-Sequence, manual and automated delineation of hippocampal borders

secondary_outcome.description: Neuropsychological assessment of a working memory domain via the Verbal Learning Memory Test (German: Helmstaedter, C., Lendt, M., Lux, S., 2001. Verbaler Lern- und Merkfähigkeitstest (VLMT). Göttingen, Beltz)

Measurement of positive and negative symptoms of schizophrenia using the "Positive and Negative Symptom Scale for Schizophrenia" (Kay SR, Fiszbein A, Opler LA. The positive and negative syndrome scale (PANSS) for schizophrenia. Schizophr Bull. 1987;13(2):261-76)

arm_group.description: Standard treatment and participation in the sports program (cycling) including cognitive training, 3 sessions cycling (30 min. each) per week for 3 months and 2 sessions Cogpack per week for the last 6 weeks.

Standard treatment and participation in an activity without physical improvement as placebo condition (table soccer in groups of 4), but including cognitive training, 3 sessions (30 min. each) per week for 3 months and 2 sessions Cogpack per week for the last 6 weeks.

Standard treatment and participation in an activity without physical improvement as placebo condition (table football in groups of 4), but including cognitive training, 3 sessions (30 min. each) per week for 3 months and 2 sessions Cogpack per week for the last 6 weeks.

intervention.description: Standard treatment and participation in the sports program (cycling) including cognitive training, 3 sessions cycling (30 min. each) per week for 3 months and 2 sessions Cogpack per week for the last 6 weeks.

Standard treatment and participation in an activity without physical improvement as placebo condition (table football in groups of 4), but including cognitive training, 3 sessions (30 min. each) per week for 3 months and 2 sessions Cogpack per week for the last 6 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and female patients with the diagnosis of schizophrenia (based on ICD-10 criteria)
- Age between 18 and 55
- Verbal IQ ≥ 85
- Stable psychopathology on constant medication for 2 weeks
- Informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
Patients, who are
- not willing or able to participate in the sports program and cognitive training
- reveal a significant worsening of psychopathology (based on an increase over 20% of the PANSS positive score)
- have an organic mental disorder (such as intoxication or neurological disorders of the CNS)
- suffer from instable somatic diseases
- have an active substance abuse
